section.title: ESX ON-Boarding Service (EON)
section.para: The &kw-hos-phrase; EON (ESX on boarding) service is an inventory service, which interacts with the VMware vCenter server, and collects available information from data centers, clusters, datastore, dvSwitch and portgroup details. When a cloud administrator wants a particular cluster to be a compute resource in &kw-hos-phrase;, EON provisions the Nova proxy service VM for each cluster, and OVSvApp service VM, for each ESX host in that cluster.
The integration of EON with &kw-hos-phrase; automates the steps for moving/adding a cluster in a compute resource. To use this functionality, you must run a few EON commands.

section.title: Architecture
section.para: EON is installed on the master control plane node, and the EON CLI is installed on the &clm;, used by the Cloud Admin to setup vCenter Compute Proxy and OvsvApp nodes.

Resource Manager List
Lists all the available Resource Managers. When --type TYPE is provided filters the list based on the TYPE.
Where <RESOURCE_MANAGER_TYPE> is the type of the Resource manager ( enter vcenter for vCenter Server).

Where <RESOURCE_MANAGER_ID> is the UUID of the vCenter.

listitem.para: Resource Manager Add
Registers a Resource Manager.
Where:
Resource Manager Name - the identical name of the vCenter server (optional).
Resource Manager IP address - the IP address of the vCenter server.
Resource Manager Username - the admin privilege username for the vCenter.
Resource Manager Password - the password for the above username.
Resource Manager Port - the vCenter server port (optional). By default it is 443.
Resource Manager Type - specify vcenter.

listitem.screen: # eon resource-manager-add --name vc01 --ip-address 10.1.200.38 --username administrator@vsphere.local --password init123# --port 443 --type vcenter +-------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +-------------+--------------------------------------+ | ID | BC9DED4E-1639-481D-B190-2B54A2BF5674 | | IPv4Address | 10.1.200.38 | | Name | vc01 | | Password | <SANITIZED> | | Port | 443 | | Type | vcenter | | Username | administrator@vsphere.local | +-------------+--------------------------------------+

section.title: Activation Operations
section.para: The Activation Operations commands spawn one compute proxy VM per cluster and one OVSvApp VM per host, does the network plumbing as mentioned in the activation JSON and updates the input model with the service VM details. The command also executes the Ansible playbooks for deployment. This can be skipped when run_playbook is set to false in the activation template, but the playbooks have to be executed manually

listitem.para: Get Activation Template
Generates a sample activation json.
Where <ACTIVATION_JSON_NAME> is the name of the activation json file and <RESOURCE_TYPE> is the type of the Resource (esxcluster for ESX Clusters).
listitem.screen: eon get-activation-template --filename activationtemplate.json --type esxcluster --------------------------------------------------------------- Saved the sample network file in /home/user/activationtemplate.json ---------------------------------------------------------------

listitem.para: Resource Activate
Activates the specified Resource Manager (ESX Cluster) with the specified activation JSON.
Where <RESOURCE_ID> is the ID of the Resource Manager (ESX Cluster).
listitem.screen: # eon resource-activate 9ab2196d-37d2-4006-a2c7-08946b5194ea --config-json activate-template.json +-----------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +-----------------+--------------------------------------+ | id | 9ab2196d-37d2-4006-a2c7-08946b5194ea | | ip_address | UNSET | | name | compute | | password | UNSET | | port | UNSET | | resource_mgr_id | 9FDCFA66-6677-42A1-83FF-16DC32448021 | | state | provision-initiated | | type | esxcluster | | username | UNSET | +-----------------+--------------------------------------+

listitem.para: Resource Deactivate
Deactivates the specified Resource Manager (ESX Cluster). Deletes the ESX compute proxy, OVSvApp VMs in the cluster and triggers the Ansible playbook execution.
Where <RESOURCE_ID> is the ID of the Resource Manager (ESX Cluster).
Force Deactivate
Cleans-up the OVSvApp and Compute Proxy VM's and updated database.

important.para: If there is any error in cleaning up the OVSvApp and Compute Proxy VM's, the exceptions are ignored and cluster are set to imported state. If the cluster is not moved back to the imported state, there is no other way that the cluster can be activated again. In this scenario, you need to manually clean up the VM's.

listitem.para: Resource Update
Add additional ESXi hosts to an already activated cluster (Host Commissioning).
Where <RESOURCE_ID> is the ID of the Resource (ESX Cluster) and <SERVER_GROUP> is the server group provided in the configuration JSON during the activation.
listitem.screen: # eon resource-update 9ab2196d-37d2-4006-a2c7-08946b5194ea --action add_host --server-group RACK01 +-----------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +-----------------+--------------------------------------+ | id | 9ab2196d-37d2-4006-a2c7-08946b5194ea | | ip_address | UNSET | | name | compute | | password | UNSET | | port | UNSET | | resource_mgr_id | 9FDCFA66-6677-42A1-83FF-16DC32448021 | | state | host-commission-initiated | | type | esxcluster | | username | UNSET | +-----------------+--------------------------------------+
